Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with band of short vertical strokes in added white between pairs of white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreleg of sphinx, to left, followed undetermined decorative motif in brown outline; below, in handle zone, double guilloche between brown bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 13, no. 13, pl. 3)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 602, pl. 76)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0594) (phase 2)
